ext_descriptions.ext_description:
A Component_to_physical_usage_view_assignment is the association between one and another , where one is in the Assembly_module_design_view and the other is in the .
The main use of this concept is to support the identification of the connector in an assembly design view that is related to a connector in a usage view for that assembly. In many cases the reference designator for the usage view is different than that of the design view, and the full details of the connector in the usage view may not be provided. In many cases, the product is not the same product as well, if there are multiple levels of assembly between the design view at which the connector is installed and the product at which the connector is made visible for interface purposes.
A connector in a PCA assembly may be J1 in that assembly. The unit in which the PCA is a low level subassembly( with a partial reference designation itself of A1A3A4) may have an access hole in the cover which makes the connector directly visible and may have identification of that connector at the product level of J12. In this case the design organization would know that A1A3A4J1 was represented at the unit level as J12.
the design_view_component specifies an for the Component_to_physical_usage_view_assignment.
the usage_view_component specifies an for the Component_to_physical_usage_view_assignment.

A Part_design_view is a type of . A Part_design_view may be an or an . A Part_design_view shall fully describe a specifically designed item in sufficient detail to permit production of that item in a manufacturing process and analysis of that item's response to a simulated environment in a computer based experimental environment.
Figure illustrates an assembly design view.

the usage_view specifies the role of the for the . The usage_view provides sufficient detail to allow the to be utilized in its next assembly, but does not provide sufficient detail to allow reproduction of the . The usage_view specifies the features visible in the next assembly and the terminals of the , if there are any. The value of this attribute need not be supplied. The usage_view shall not be for the but shall be supplied for all other types of .

The text description for this Application Object has not been fully updated to agree with the EXPRESS.
An Assembly_component may be one of an , a , an , a , a , or a , or additionally may be an , or additionally may be a , or additionally may be a , or additionally may be a , or additionally may be an . An Assembly_component is the occurrence of a or in an assembly or in an interconnect. An Assembly_component may inclusage_definitione additional product data over that defined in or Part_template. An Assembly_component that is no other type is intended to be an instance of a and not of a Part_template.
Figure illustrates a detail of an assembly drawing that shows the Assembly_component in relation to a cross-sectional view of the . Figure illustrates a complete assembly showing multiple Assembly_component.
An Assembly_component may be assembled onto an in the realization of an . An Assembly_component may be an occurrence of an . An Assembly_component may be an occurrence of an . For the purposes of this model, the current interpretation is to treat an embedded component as a . The that mates with the of the embedded component is not visible when the is assembled, but the is still logically the interface to the for the embedded component.
The manufacturing view supports the fact that the embedded component is installed during part of the sequential manufacturing for the .
A Part_template occurrence is not permitted in an assembly definition.
An Assembly_component may be a floor-planning symbol if the definition is an or an . If the Assembly_component is used in this manner, then the actual components will be inclusage_definitioned in the design in a later iteration that results from inclusage_definitioning the detailed components from the or using a computer processor. The processor may choose to support traceability by using the to specify what component of the or corresponds to the component in the design.
Parameters may be assigned to Assembly_component by the object through the Assembly_requirements_allocation.

A Component_make_from_relationship is the association between one and another , where one results from full or partial reuse of the other. A Component_make_from_relationship may be a .
The main use of this concept is design reuse where the modification consists of the fact that the is in a different assembly from the original design, or where the original design is a reference design.
the resultant_component specifies the for the that results from the reuse of the reusable_component in the Component_make_from_relationship.
the reusable_component specifies the for the that is reused to create the resultant_component in the Component_make_from_relationship.
A Physical_component is a type of . A Physical_component is one of a , a , an , an , a , a , or a , or additionally may be an .

A Thermal_component is a type of that is included in the design in order to satisfy a heat flow requirement.
An utilized as a Thermal_component may be another type of as well.
Examples of Thermal_component are: a heatsink, a thermal via, an active thermal cooler (such as a fan), or a thermoelectric cooler.
